title.narrative: Mozambique Disaster Risk Management and Resilience Program

description.narrative: The Program Development Objective is to strengthen the Government of Mozambique's program to finance and prepare for disaster response and to increase the climate resilience of vulnerable education infrastructure in risk-prone areas.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Education and Human Development

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

description.narrative: Total Commitment in First Quarter of 2019

Total Disbursement in First Quarter of 2020

condition.narrative: Within six (6) months after the Effective Date, the Recipient shall adopt the POM, as approved by the Association and thereafter,implement the Program and Project in accordance with the POM.

title.narrative: Ex-ante resources immediately available annually for disaster preparedness and response
Risk transfer products for cyclone and/or drought risk have undergone an external technical review
New or strengthened local DRM committees with at least 50% of female committee members created or trained
Number of classrooms in risk-prone areas retrofitted or reconstructed in accordance with climate-resilient technical norms under the Program
Sovereign catastrophe insurance coverage for at least one peril (cyclone and/or drought) with capital or insurance market in place,in accordance with national Disaster Risk Finance Strategy
Stand-by contracts for disaster response signed with at least two firms annually
National Disaster Risk Finance Strategy developed and adopted
Annual independent audits on use of funds under DMF completed and recommendations implemented
MOUs between INAM, DNGRH, and INGD are established or revised
Maintenance arrangements for the rehabilitated school infrastructure developed and implemented
National School Database upgraded and updated with data from building assessment
Ministerial diploma adopting technical norms for climate-resilient education infrastructure in place
Number of people in risk-prone areas reached by flood and cyclone early warning systems under the Program
Number of people in risk-prone areas covered by functioning local DRM committees under the Program
Number of children provided with access to climate-resilient education infrastructure under the Program
Grievances registered related to delivery of Program benefits that are actually addressed (INGC)
Grievances registered related to delivery of Program benefits that are actually addressed (MINEDH)
Number of functional local DRM committees in risk-prone areas established or strengthened
